    • Field Detail

      • pathPrefix

        public final java.lang.String pathPrefix
        The prefix to which to match the start of the path to if exactPathMatch is false, or the full path (excluding the query string) to match if exactPathMatch is true.

      • exactPathMatch

        public final boolean exactPathMatch
        If true, the entire path (rather than just the beginning of the path) of every request will be compared to pathPrefix.

        For example, the pathPrefix "/abc/" would match "/abc/def/" if and only if exactPathMatch is false.

      • view

        protected final View view
        The view to use if the request path matches this route. This object will be reused for each and every request.

      • viewClass

        protected final java.lang.Class viewClass
        The Class object representing the view to use if the request path matches this route. A new instance of this class will be created for each and every request.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Route

        protected Route(java.lang.String path)
        Initializes this route with an exact match for the given path.
        Parameters:
        path - The path that this Route will match.

      • Route

        protected Route(java.lang.String pathPrefix,
     boolean exactPathMatch)
        Initializes this route with an exact or prefix match for the given path.
        Parameters:
        pathPrefix - The path or prefix that this Route will match.
        exactPathMatch - Whether to match the path exactly or by prefix.

      • Route

        public Route(java.lang.String path,
     View view)
        Initializes this route with an exact match for the given path. See Route(String, View, boolean) for caveats.
        Parameters:
        path - The path that this Route will match.
        view - The view to use when this route matches the path.
        See Also:
        Route(String, View, boolean)

      • Route

        public Route(java.lang.String pathPrefix,
     View view,
     boolean exactPathMatch)
        Initializes this route with an exact or prefix match for the given path. The specified view will be re-used for every request from different threads.

        If your view class is not thread-safe, consider using Route(String, Class) instead.

        Parameters:
        pathPrefix - The path or prefix that this Route will match.
        view - The view to use when this route matches the path.
        exactPathMatch - Whether to match the path exactly or by prefix.

      • Route

        public Route(java.lang.String path,
     java.lang.Class viewClass)
        Initializes this route with an exact match for the given path. A new instance of the specified class will be created for each request.
        Parameters:
        path - The path that this Route will match.
        viewClass - The class of the view to use when this route matches the path.

      • Route

        public Route(java.lang.String pathPrefix,
     java.lang.Class viewClass,
     boolean exactPathMatch)
        Initializes this route with an exact or prefix match for the given path. A new instance of the specified class will be created for each request.
        Parameters:
        pathPrefix - The path or prefix that this Route will match.
        viewClass - The class of the view to use when this route matches the path.
        exactPathMatch - Whether to match the path exactly or by prefix.

    • Method Detail

      • matches

        public boolean matches(java.lang.String path)
        Matches a path to this route. This method may be overridden for custom path matching.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to match.
        Returns:
        true if this route matches the given path, false otherwise.

      • getView

        public View getView(Request req)
        Retrieves the view for handling the given request.

        The default implementation does the following:

        1. If view is defined, return that.
        2. If viewClass is defined, create a new instance of that and return it.
        3. If neither view nor viewClass are defined, return null.
        Parameters:
        req - The request object, guaranteed to match this route.
        Returns:
        The view for processing the given request.
